meanings.definition: A thing that causes disgust or hatred.
meanings.sent1: The rotten food in the fridge was an abomination.
meanings.sent2: The sight of the monster was an abomination to the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The messy room was an abomination to the neat freak.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house stood as an abomination in the quiet neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the historic building was an abomination to the city's history.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or hatred.
meanings.sent1: She shuddered with abomination at the creepy crawlies.
meanings.sent2: His abomination towards spiders made him avoid the basement.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the strange dish filled her with abomination.
meanings.sent4: The politician's lies stirred up a deep abomination in the public.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage truck caused an instant abomination in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To regard with disgust or hatred.
meanings.sent1: She abominated the idea of eating snails.
meanings.sent3: The cat abominated the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: The community abominated the proposal to cut down the old trees.
meanings.sent5: The teacher abominated cheating in exams and always caught the students.
